DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to assess early ambulation following total knee replacement in patients receiving continuous adductor canal block with posterior capsular injection compared to continuous femoral nerve block with tibial nerve block.
DOC.brief_title: Early Ambulation After Adductor Canal Block for Total Knee Arthroplasty
DOC.criteria: knee arthroplasty ages 1880 history of neurological disease diabetes pregnancy neuropathy chronic narcotic use allergy to local anesthetic solution or NSAIDS inability to give consent or cooperate with the study protocol
